title: first Day Attendance Quiz
description:
------------------
Syllabus Agreement
------------------

This important activity satisfies the "First Day Attendance" policy for this course. It will let me know that you are indeed enrolled and participating in the course. If you do not submit within the first day of class, you risk being dropped from the course. Carefully review the syllabus.

title: M1 Quiz: Course Requirements Checklist (First Day Attendance)
description:
-------------
Module 1 Quiz
-------------

 Course Requirements Checklist (First Day Attendance)
-----------------------------------------------------

As your first assignment in this course, read the [course syllabus and schedule.](https://usflearn.instructure.com/courses/1979796/assignments/syllabus) You will be allowed multiple attempts, and your highest score will count toward your grade.

   This quiz satisfies the "First Day Attendance" policy for this online course and is graded 10 points. To ensure your enrollment, be sure to take the quiz by wednesday first week of classes, 11:59 p.m. (ET).

title: Chapter 2 Quiz
description: Chapter 2 Quiz: No extension will be accepted.

title: Media Release
description:
--------
    Quiz
--------

  Media Release
---------------

As part of IDS3947, some artifacts (photos, videos, etc) may be used for promotional purposes outside of Canvas by the University of South Florida.

By completing the media release, you are consenting to the university using your information for these purposes. Please read the coordinating statement in the following quiz questions and feel free to ask your instructor for further information if needed.

description:
-------------

 Science and the Environment
----------------------------

title: M3 Discussion: Population and Communities
description:
-------------------
Module 3 Discussion
-------------------

 Population and Communities
---------------------------

Prompt
------

Describe how a human action such as removing a top predator, or adding a species, can have an impact on many species in an ecosystem.

Reply
-----

Review one of your peer’s responses to the above question and identify and discuss a policy that can be deployed in preventing that human action of removing a top predator or adding a species to an ecosystem.

Discussion Guidelines
---------------------

* Discussions are collaborative learning experiences.

* You will post one thread of at least 300 words in response to a provided prompt by 11.59 p.m. (ET).

* Then, post a reply of at least 150 words to a classmate's thread by 11.59 p.m. (ET).

* For each thread, you must support your assertions with at least 1 scholarly citation in the current APA format. Each reply must incorporate at least 1 scholarly citation in APA format. Acceptable sources include books, journal articles, .edu, .org, or .gov websites, the course textbook, etc. A Wikipedia reference will not count towards your minimum citation count.

* For help on how to submit discussion posts, see [How Do I Reply to a Discussion as a Student? Links to an external site.](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-reply-to-a-discussion-as-a-student/ta-p/334)

* This discussion is worth 50 points and will be graded according to the Discussion Board Forum Rubric. For help on how to access the rubric, see [How Do I View the Rubric for My Graded Discussion? Links to an external site.](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-view-the-rubric-for-my-graded-discussion/ta-p/319)

title: M5 Critical Thinking Assignment: Population Growth and Natural Resource Degradation
description:
-------------------------------------
Module 5 Critical Thinking Assignment
-------------------------------------

 Population Growth and Natural Resource Degradation
---------------------------------------------------

Critical Thinking Assignments (CTAs) are short essay assignments designed to build on your knowledge of the text. You will be expected to thoughtfully answer the questions presented using class readings and other resources in Pearson Mastering to support your answers. Read and respond to the essay question below. Do not forget to review the accompanying instructions.

Essay Question
--------------

Suppose you are the head of an island nation with a poor, growing population and the natural resources of the island are being degraded. What kinds of policies would you initiate, and what help would you ask for to try to provide a better, sustainable future for your nation’s people?

CTA Instructions
----------------

* Length: The CTA should be between 500 to 600 words excluding references.

* Format: Should be written in the APA format.

* References: You should have at least three peer-reviewed journal articles or scholarly books. Sources may include both general background sources and specialized sources. All websites utilized are cited with access dates and should come from authoritative sites with reliable and verifiable URLs.

* Writing quality: The arguments should be well-grounded/written and clearly articulated using Standard English. Correct grammar, punctuation, and spelling. No colloquial English.

* Note: Your assignment will be checked for originality via the [Turnitin plagiarism tool.](https://usflearn.instructure.com/courses/1979796/pages/getting-started-with-technology)

Rubric and Submission Guidelines
--------------------------------

* This assignment is worth 50 points and will be graded according to the Critical Thinking Assignment Rubric.

* Submit by 11.59 p.m. (ET) on the due date.

* Upload your assignment as a Microsoft Word document or PDF. For additional help, see [How Do I Upload a File as an Assignment Submission in Canvas](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-upload-a-file-as-an-assignment-submission-in-Canvas/ta-p/274).[ Links to an external site.](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-upload-a-file-as-an-assignment-submission-in-Canvas/ta-p/274)

title: M7 Critical Thinking Assignment: My Everyday Activities and Water Pollution
description:
-------------------------------------
Module 7 Critical Thinking Assignment
-------------------------------------

 My Everyday Activity and Water Pollution
-----------------------------------------

Critical Thinking Assignments (CTAs) are short essay assignments designed to build on your knowledge of the text. You will be expected to thoughtfully answer the questions presented using class readings and other resources in Pearson Mastering to support your answers. Read and respond to the essay question below. Do not forget to review the accompanying instructions.

Essay Question
--------------

Describe how many of your everyday activities, including your demands for food and other materials, add pollution to the water cycle or alter it in other ways. How can you be more stewardly with your water consumption?

CTA Instructions
----------------

* Length: The CTA should be between 500 to 600 words, excluding references.

* Format: Should be written in the APA format.

* References: You should have at least three peer-reviewed journal articles or scholarly books. Sources may include both general background sources and specialized sources. All websites utilized are cited with access dates and should come from authoritative sites with reliable and verifiable URLs.

* Writing quality: The arguments should be well-grounded/written and clearly articulated using Standard English. Correct grammar, punctuation, and spelling. No colloquial English.

* Note: Your assignment will be checked for originality via the [Turnitin plagiarism tool.](https://usflearn.instructure.com/courses/1979796/pages/gf9f999249e1d830efb3bd04e284abe9f)

Rubric and Submission Guidelines
--------------------------------

* This assignment is worth 50 points and will be graded according to the Critical Thinking Assignment Rubric.

* Submit by 11.59 p.m. (ET) on the due date.

* Upload your assignment as a Microsoft Word document or PDF. For additional help, see [How Do I Upload a File as an Assignment Submission in Canvas?Links to an external site.](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-upload-a-file-as-an-assignment-submission-in-Canvas/ta-p/274)

title: M11 Discussion: Steps to Lower My Climate Change
description:
--------------------
Module 11 Discussion
--------------------

 Steps to Lower My Climate Change
---------------------------------

Prompt
------

List and discuss five steps you could take to lower your climate impact. Check the Union of Concerned Scientists Web site for suggestions.

Reply
-----

Review one of your peer’s responses to the above question and identify and discuss a policy that can be deployed in promoting one step your peer has suggested.

Discussion Guidelines
---------------------

* Discussions are collaborative learning experiences.

* You will post one thread of at least 300 words in response to a provided prompt by 11.59 p.m. (ET).

* Then, post a reply of at least 150 words to a classmate's thread by 11.59 p.m. (ET).

* For each thread, you must support your assertions with at least 1 scholarly citation in the current APA format. Each reply must incorporate at least 1 scholarly citation in APA format. Acceptable sources include books, journal articles, .edu, .org, or .gov websites, the course textbook, etc. A Wikipedia reference will not count towards your minimum citation count.

* For help on how to submit discussion posts, see [How Do I Reply to a Discussion as a Student? Links to an external site.](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-reply-to-a-discussion-as-a-student/ta-p/334)

* This discussion is worth 50 points and will be graded according to the Discussion Board Forum Rubric. For help on how to access the rubric, see [How Do I View the Rubric for My Graded Discussion? Links to an external site.](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-view-the-rubric-for-my-graded-discussion/ta-p/319)

title: M13 Critical Thinking Assignment: The Role of the CDC, WHO, FDA and EPA
description:
--------------------------------------
Module 13 Critical Thinking Assignment
--------------------------------------

 The Role of the CDC, WHO, FDA and EPA
--------------------------------------

Critical Thinking Assignments (CTAs) are short essay assignments designed to build on your knowledge of the text. You will be expected to thoughtfully answer the questions presented using class readings and other resources in Pearson Mastering to support your answers. Read and respond to the essay question below. Do not forget to review the accompanying instructions.

Essay Question
--------------

Describe the public health roles and two critiques of each of the following agencies the CDC, the WHO, the FDA and the EPA.

CTA Instructions
----------------

* Length: The CTA should be between 500 to 600 words excluding references.

* Format: Should be written in the APA format.

* References: You should have at least three peer-reviewed journal articles or scholarly books. Sources may include both general background sources and specialized sources. All websites utilized are cited with access dates and should come from authoritative sites with reliable and verifiable URLs.

* Writing quality: The arguments should be well-grounded/written and clearly articulated using Standard English. Correct grammar, punctuation, and spelling. No colloquial English.

* Note: Your assignment will be checked for originality via the [Turnitin plagiarism tool.](https://usflearn.instructure.com/courses/1979796/pages/getting-started-with-technology)

Rubric and Submission Guidelines
--------------------------------

* This assignment is worth 50 points and will be graded according to the Critical Thinking Assignment Rubric.

* Submit by 11.59 p.m. (ET) on the due date.

* Upload your assignment as a Microsoft Word document or PDF. For additional help, see [How Do I Upload a File as an Assignment Submission in Canvas?Links to an external site.](https://community.canvaslms.com/t5/Student-Guide/How-do-I-upload-a-file-as-an-assignment-submission-in-Canvas/ta-p/274)
